### ğŸ“— DistribuiÃ§Ã£o Normal (Z)

#### ğŸ“˜ VersÃ£o estÃ¡tica

```{r}
linhas <- seq(0.0, 3.9, by = 0.1)
colunas <- seq(0.00, 0.09, by = 0.01)

tabela_z <- data.frame(z = linhas)

for (c in colunas) {
  tabela_z[[sprintf("%.2f", c)]] <- pnorm(linhas + c)
}

tabela_z[, -1] <- round(tabela_z[, -1], 4)

knitr::kable(
  tabela_z,
  caption = "Tabela Z â€“ P(Z â‰¤ z)",
  align = "c"
)
```


### ğŸ“™ DistribuiÃ§Ã£o t de Student

#### ğŸ“˜ VersÃ£o estÃ¡tica

```{r}
gl <- c(1:10, 12, 15, 20, 30, 60, 120)

conf <- c(
  "90%" = 0.95,
  "95%" = 0.975,
  "99%" = 0.995
)

tabela_t <- data.frame(GL = gl)

for (nome in names(conf)) {
  tabela_t[[nome]] <- qt(conf[nome], df = gl)
}

tabela_t[, -1] <- round(tabela_t[, -1], 3)

knitr::kable(
  tabela_t,
  caption = "Tabela t de Student â€“ Teste bilateral",

)
```
